value: Horwich's Parish Church is a major local landmark.

is a small but bustling town in the borough of

Originally a farming community, Horwich built its wealth and earned its name through the railways and locomotive works that settled in the town before their closure in 1984.

Today it is home to the

opened in 1998: a large retail park with an array of stores including Marks & Spencer, Tesco, Homebase, Boots the Chemist, Asda, Vue cinema, Hollywood Bowl, McDonalds and Pizza Hut to name a few.

Horwich is a very pleasant, scenic area with friendly people and a friendly atmosphere. Located as it is the

Travellers should be aware that, in places, Chorley Old Road has other names as it runs through Horwich including Lee Lane and Church Street. If asking for directions, Chorley Old Road serves as a catch-all for these different names.

Horwich is in general no more dangerous than other northern towns and Police recently made the town centre a dispersal zone, giving them powers to disperse groups of people.
